Montanans sent me to Washington to deliver results, and I will continue to take on anyone—including Big Pharma—to lower costs.
For too long, Big Pharma has jacked up prices on our seniors. With my Inflation Reduction Act, we're finally holding these massive pharmaceutical corporations accountable.
Montanans should never have to choose between putting food on the table and securing life-saving medication. Full stop.

Starting this week, we're taking steps to lower the cost of 10 of the most common prescription drugs—and that's just the start.

My Inflation Reduction Act will continue to target common prescription drugs for price cuts for years to come.

Montanans from all across our state told me about the need to lower costs, and I fought to make sure the Inflation Reduction Act did just that. 
 
But whether it's high housing prices, child care costs, or grocery bills, I'll keep working to cut costs across the board.

A year ago today, we passed the Inflation Reduction Act to:
 
📉 Pay down the debt
💊 Slash prescription drug prices
🩺 Cap health care costs
🇺🇸 Invest in American energy
🌎 And protect our climate
 
ALL without raising taxes on Montanans, but by holding corporations accountable.

ONE YEAR OF THE PACT ACT:

— 4,100,000+ vets screened for toxic-exposure, including 23,000+ in Montana

— 843,000+ PACT Act claims, including ~4,300 in Montana

— 133,000+ toxic-exposed vets newly enrolled in VA health care, including 1,700+ Montana vets

That's a big damn deal.

A year after finally delivering toxic-exposed veterans the care and benefits they've earned, I'm proud to see the PACT Act making a real difference in veterans' lives. I'll make sure VA keeps it that way.

It's been one year since the PACT Act was signed into law to finally do right by generations of toxic-exposed veterans.

Now, hundreds of thousands of veterans and their families are receiving the health care and benefits they earned.

I'm proud we're continuing our bipartisan push to recognize these incredible women, their service to the nation, and their subsequent 60-year fight for equal treatment as veterans. Let's get this done. (6/6)

The Hello Girls risked their lives to protect our nation and led critical efforts that helped our allied forces win the war. They blazed a new path for women on the front lines, and the Congressional Gold Medal will honor their service and fight for recognition as veterans. (5/6)

One of these women was Merle Egan Anderson of Montana. Merle led the effort to get the Hello Girls the recognition they deserved, petitioning Congress more than 50 times to acknowledge their veteran status.

And in 1977, Congress finally got things right and did. (4/6)

They served at military headquarters and commanded outposts in the field alongside the American Expeditionary Forces.

But despite their outstanding service, they were denied their veteran status and benefits when they returned home. (3/6)

The Hello Girls are the women of the U.S. Army Signal Corps—recruited during World War I after male infantrymen struggled to connect calls quickly and communicate with their French counterparts.

These bilingual women were deployed to France and took the Army oath in 1917. (2/6)

NEWS: @JerryMoran, @SenatorHassan, @MarshaBlackburn, and I are leading a bipartisan effort to honor the Hello Girls with Congressional Gold Medals for their extraordinary service to our nation in World War I.

Who are the Hello Girls? Glad you asked... (1/6) #WomensHistoryMonth

Montana vets can find a local VA-accredited Veteran Service Officer at their nearest state Veterans Affairs Division office.

Locations, hours, and contact information: dma.mt.gov/MVAD/veterans-ben…

The good news is a VA-accredited Veteran Service Officer can help you file a claim and apply for health care for free. Even if you were previously denied a toxic exposure claim, VA could grant your claim now that the PACT Act is law.

Folks, it’s 2023. That means VA is now processing ALL claims related to the PACT Act—a law we championed to deliver health care and benefits to toxic-exposed veterans of all eras, from the Vietnam War generation to the Post-9/11 era. More info on filing claims below ⬇️
